SEARCH
Package courseWork1

Class MatrixOps

java.lang.Object
courseWork1.MatrixOps
public class MatrixOps extends Object
Class containing methods for generating arrays, mathematical calculations, and constructing output data for main MatrixApplication.

  • Method Details

    • promptAndValidate

      public static int promptAndValidate(int minNum, int maxNum, String prompt)
      Prompts the user to enter an integer between minNum and maxNum, validating that it is an integer within the specified range.
      Parameters:
      minNum - The minimum accepted integer
      maxNum - The maximum accepted integer
      prompt - The message to display when prompting user
      Returns:
      The value entered by user once validated

    • populateArray

      public static void populateArray(int[][] array)
      This populates an integer 2D array with random numbers. For rows that are even(row #2) it populates with just even numbers and if the row is an odd (row #1) it populates with odd numbers only.
      Parameters:
      array - integer array that will be populated with random #s

    • copy2DArray

      public static void copy2DArray(int[][] originalArray, int[][] bakOfArray)
      Copies content of an integer 2D array to another integer 2D array.
      Parameters:
      originalArray - Array to be copied
      bakOfArray - Copy of originalArray

    • getAverageRows

      public static void getAverageRows(int[][] array, float[] array2)
      Computes the average of each row and stores them in a float array.
      Parameters:
      array - Array containing values to get average
      array2 - Array where the averages will be stored

      public static void getAverageColumns(int[][] array, float[] array2)

      array2 - Array where the averages will be stored

      public static float getAverageOfArray(int[][] array)
      Computes the average of all values in an integer 2D array and returns the average

      Returns:

    • addAveragesToArray

      public static void addAveragesToArray(int[][] originalArray, float[][] arrayWithAverages, float[] rowAverages, float[] colAverages, float allAverage)
      Copies content of an integer 2D Array and adds in row, column and total averages.
      Parameters:
      originalArray - Original array to be copied
      arrayWithAverages - a float array that will containing values of originalArray with extra row and column
      rowAverages - Row averages to be added to arrayWithAverages
      colAverages - Column averages to be added to arrayWithAverages
      allAverage - Averages of all values of an Array to be added to arrayWithAverages

    • getSecondLargest

      public static int getSecondLargest(float[] array)
      Checks a float array for the second largest value and returns the index location of the value.
      Parameters:
      array - Array containing values
      Returns:
      The index number of the second largest

    • modify2DArray

      public static void modify2DArray(int[][] twoDArray, float[] rowAverages, float[] colAverages)
      Modifies an integer 2D array by replacing values with -1, 1, and 0 based on row and columns averages.
      Parameters:
      twoDArray - The array to be modified
      rowAverages - Array with row averages to check
      colAverages - Array with column averages to check

    • getValueCounts

      public static void getValueCounts(int[][] arrayToCheck, int[] arrayToTrack)
      Check a 2D array for values equal to -1, 1 and 0 and stores the count of each on an integer array.
      Parameters:
      arrayToCheck - The array with the values to check
      arrayToTrack - Array to store the counts

      Parameters:
      arrayWithCounts - Array with counts
      Returns:
      string to output

      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • constructPrintAverage

      public static String constructPrintAverage(float[] arrayOfAverages, Boolean isRow)
      Constructs a String to display values of a float array. String construction requires to state if the array is for rows or columns.
      Parameters:
      arrayOfAverages - array that has the average values
      isRow - if true then String will be constructed for rows. If false string will be constructed for columns
      Returns:
      string to display averages for rows or columns

    • constructPrintAll

      public static String constructPrintAll(int[][] twoDArrayBak, float[][] twoDArrayWithAverages, float[] rowAverages, float[] colAverages, float averageOfAllInArray, int rowPos, int colPos, int[][] twoDArray, int[] valCounts)
      Construct String to display all the gathered information.
      Parameters:
      twoDArrayBak - a backup integer 2D array that contains values when original array was first created
      twoDArrayWithAverages - integer 2D array with averages added on the last rows and columns
      rowAverages - float array with averages of rows
      colAverages - float array with averages of columns
      averageOfAllInArray - average of all values in original array before being modified.
      rowPos - the position of the second largest value in the rows of the original array before being modified
      colPos - the position of the second largest value in the columns of the original array before being modified
      twoDArray - the original array that has been modified with -1, 1, and 0s
      valCounts - integer array that keeps track of how many -1, 1, and 0s are on the original array
      Returns:
      string to display all the information of the MatrixApplication
